text: A great free workshop for students tomorrow at DVC!

We cannot achieve our goal of building housing for all Californians at all income levels if some local jurisdictions continue to place a disproportionate financial burden on the backs of new home buyers
Thank you @cayimby for your support! Together we are going to build more housing!

He is absolutely right that our communities need both immediate relief and long term solutions in the form of increased housing production and smart transit oriented development. I look forward to working with Gov @GavinNewsom and my colleagues on these issues this year #caleg
I applaud the @CAgovernor for dedicating his State of the State address this morning to some of California’s most pressing issues: our homelessness, housing, and affordability crises.
“Ashbury” found their valentine and future home!
Chloe the Cat has found her “purr-fect” companions!
There are more dogs and cats still looking for companions! My wife, Tammy, and I are having a great time saying hello to them all!
“Lovebird” has found their forever home and been adopted!
Whether you’re looking to adopt a pet or to visit @ARFtweets Valentine’s Day themed photo booth, I hope you’ll stop by today!
My dog, Shasta, and I will be at @ARFtweets this afternoon saying hello and helping people and pets find their “purr-fect companions”!
In celebration of #ValentinesDay today, I am teaming up with @ARFtweets to waive all fees to help pets find their forever homes!

Last night Zack Gottsagen became the first person with Down Syndrome to present at the #Oscars! It was a highlight of the night for my family and me, and I’m sure so many others! #ChooseToInclude #RepresentationMatters

Today on International Holocaust Remembrance Day we mourn the millions of innocent Jewish victims and more who were murdered. We must #NeverAgain allow such atrocities to occur, and must continue to fight anti-Semitism, bigotry, and hate.
Met two very kind @SFBART officers on my ride yesterday as they were saying hello to everyone on our train. Thank you for working to keep BART friendly and safe
A huge congratulations to Chief Clerk Sue Parker and Chief Sergeant Alisa Buckley!

I was proud to author and pass legislation in 2019 to end predatory lending, stop unjust evictions, increase mental health services for our first responders, and help fund the CA Special Olympics—just to name a few! Can’t wait to work together to accomplish more in 2020 #CALeg
Wishing everyone a holiday season surrounded by loved ones and filled with joy! Merry Christmas and happy holidays!
Yes, we’ve restricted the ability of bad-acting landlords to unjustly and unfairly force Californians out of their homes #AB1482

I hope you will join me tomorrow in Vallejo for a Holiday Open House! More details on the FB event page here: https://www.facebook.com/events/494131497865012/ @CityofVallejo @VisitVallejo @vjotimesherald
Great job @VallejoFire! Our community is lucky to have you!
Thank you @foodbankccs for allowing me to join you at one of your food distribution sites! Wonderful to spend time with Food Bank staff, volunteers, and recipients! #EndHunger
Helpful information on how to participate in the presidential primary election for No Party Preference voters #BeAVoter

CA must also take action. I've been working on legislation to update the Credit Services Act of 1984 & expand consumer protections. My bill, AB 699, will significantly enhance the transparency and disclosure of services being purchased, intended results, and costs.

.@Google has taken an important step to update its financial products and services policy to restrict the advertisement of non-certified debt settlement, debt management services, and credit repair services.

While CA has some of the strongest consumer protections for other industries, current law does not require credit service organizations to provide even basic info about the services they will render, a cost estimate, a timeline for when their services will be complete, and more.
Wonderful news! Congratulations to @sixflagsDK
Today is #GivingTuesday, a great opportunity to give to organizations that inspire you and are helping to make our communities better places to live #helpingchange #nonprofits #givingwithcare

Tonight is my Annual Holiday Open House & Toy Drive at my Concord District Office! I hope you’ll stop by and say hello! More info on my FB page here: https://facebook.com/events/817036798754554/?ti=icl
If you’re participating in Black Friday today, remember to shop local and support our community business owners! #SmallBusinessSaturday
Wishing everyone a happy and meaningful Thanksgiving!
Looking for a way to spread some holiday cheer? All fire departments in Vallejo are now accepting toy donations! #ToysForTots
I’m thankful for the wonderful work the Contra Costa Family Justice Center does to help those in our community who are in need of support. Happy Thanksgiving!

As a parent myself, I know how precious those early years are, and how much you'll enjoy spending less time traveling and away from home. I look forward to working alongside you for one more year, and to seeing what the future has in store for you and your family!
My heart and condolences go out to the entire Tyson family. Bernard helped transform a health care organization into a true community organization. He will be missed.

Experiences of women & girls of color have been largely absent from our housing crisis discussion.These perspectives are essential to our collective efforts to find meaningful solutions & I sincerely thank Dr Hancock Alfaro & @cayimby for bringing this important research to light
Thank you, firefighters and first responders!! #KincadeFire is officially contained

For many in California and across the country, today is #ElectionDay. It is a great day to #BeAVoter or to register to be one if you aren’t already! In CA you can register online at http://registertovote.ca.gov
An act of heroism follow by an incredibly moving moment—thank you, John!

There are a lot of firefighters doing incredible work today. I am very thankful for those in our community—and communities across our state—who are working to keep us safe.
Today alone fires have caused multiple evacuation warnings and orders in Contra Costa County. Please sign up for our community warning system, do everything to reduce your fire risk, and stay safe

(THREAD): October is Domestic Violence Awareness Month. If you or someone you love are in need of support, please do not hesitate to reach out to one of the resources below. Together we can end domestic violence.

The shelter in place has been LIFTED for all affected areas and HWY 80 has been reopened in both directions. THANK YOU to our firefighters, CHP, health officials, and everyone who worked to keep our community safe during this fire.
The fire has now been contained (thank you firefighters!) but please wait for official confirmation of the shelter in place being lifted before leaving home
Be sure to check @511SFBay before your morning commute tomorrow
A huge thank you to our firefighters who are doing everything they can to contain this fire
Due to the close proximity to a refinery, additional precautions are being taken to ensure this fire does not escalate. Please avoid the area and stay safe.
After taking a number of calls from concerned community members, I want to clear up confusion & address that it is not a refinery on fire, but storage tanks owned by an energy company.
.@CoCoHealth are also providing updates here: https://cchealth.org/ My office and I are in contact with all relevant agencies to make sure I can provide you with updates.

As of 6:45pm tonight, the shelter in place is still active for Crockett and Rodeo due to a fire at the NuStar Energy facility. If you are not already signed-up for Contra Costa’s Emergency Alert System, you can do so here:
The shelter in place is still in effect due to the fire at the NuStar Energy facility
SHELTER IN PLACE has been issued for Crockett and Rodeo
Remember to treat traffic signals affected by outages as stop signs, and please drive with an abundance of caution #PGEpowershutdown

As info on potential PG&E outages continue to be updated, I would encourage all customers to sign up for PG&E text alerts by texting “ENROLL” to 97633. You can find a list of Resource Centers at http://www.caloes.ca.gov & I will continue to provide as many updates here as I can

.@CaltransHQ is encouraging drivers to remember that traffic signals that are out should be treated as a stop sign. Caldecott and Tom Lantos tunnels are expected to remain open in the event of a power shutoff. Toll and movable bridges are expected to be unaffected.
.@SFBART expects no disruptions to train service, even if outages occur. Escalators at some stations may be out of service, but elevators are expected to be operational.

.@johnmuirhealth has confirmed through PG&E that Walnut Creek & Concord Medical Centers won’t be impacted by planned outages. Services at Orinda (including the Orinda Urgent Care) & Lafayette care sites could be impacted. For info, call (925) 952-2887

.@mowdiabloregion announced that they will continue to deliver meals as long as possible across @CCCounty. If meal delivery is interrupted, clients are encouraged to utilize their emergency packs which contain enough food for 6 meals. MOWDR staff may be reached at (925) 937-8311.

.@foodbankccs will continue food distributions as normal & do not anticipate being affected by potential power outages. If you visit one of the Food Bank’s partner agencies (like pantries and soup kitchens) you are encouraged to call first to ensure they are still open
Power shutoffs in Contra Costa have been delayed again. This time until 8:00 PM this evening. #PGEpowershutdown
.@sfchronicle has a map of the PG&E power shut-off zone that is searchable by address:
.@KPIXtv has compiled a guide of safety tips and is routinely updating on local schools, cities, transportation, and other utilities that might be affected:
.@nbcbayarea has published a list of resource centers that will be open across the state. These centers will have bottled water, electronic-device charging, and air conditioning. List here:
PG&E cusomters can sign up for power outage text alerts by texting “ENROLL” to 97633. Residents can also enroll in zip code alerts by calling 1-877-9000-PGE.

(THREAD): Below are some resources that I hope will be helpful to you. If you have trouble finding info, my District Offices may be able to assist you and can be reached by phone at: —Concord Office: (925) 521-1511 —Vallejo Office: (707) 642-0134 #pgeshutoff
I am deeply worried for the safety of Californians over the coming days, and concerned about the choices being made by PG&E executives. (3/3)

There will be kids who can’t attend school, people unable to make it to their jobs, vulnerable seniors not able to properly store their medication or operate their medical devices, and entire cities operating in the dark. (2/3)
Years of neglect and insufficient service of PG&E’s infrastructure might again put Californians at risk. As many as 2.5 million people could be affected by these power outages. (1/3)
BART anticipates that train service will run as normal #pgeshutoff
A list of resource centers that will be open across the state can be found below. Centers will have bottled water, electronic-device charging stations, and air-conditioning #pgeshutoff
Helpful info from @sfchronicle about how services, schools, transportation, & hospitals could be affected #pgeshutoff
.@KPIXtv has compiled a guide of safety tips and ways to prepare for potential @PGE4Me power outages. They also have a list of cities that may be affected and links to PG&E resources
PG&E cusomters can sign up for power outage text alerts by texting “ENROLL” to 97633. Residents can also enroll in zip code alerts by calling 1-877-9000-PGE (via @KTVU)
Tomorrow you can watch live as I join my fellow joint-authors and Governor @GavinNewsom for the official signing of our historic tenant protection legislation! Details below #AB1482

Tonight Governor @GavinNewsom signed my bill to extend the funding source for air ambulances that was set to expire at the end of this year. #AB651 will ensure that Californians across our state have access to these critical emergency services
More information can be found here:

When our state experienced some of the deadliest wildfires in its history, more CA firefighters died by suicide than in the line of duty. Today we offer a life-line to these brave women & men who might otherwise suffer in silence. Thank you @CAgovernor for signing my bill #AB1116

As a co-founder of the Central County Center, I am so grateful for the work of the executive director, Susun Kim, all of the FJC's staff, and the community, who helped to make today possible and allow us to serve even more survivors. (3/3)
Family Justice Centers (FJCs) serve survivors of domestic and interpersonal violence and work to help them receive justice, support, and healing. (2/3)
Thrilled to join the Contra Costa Family Justice Center for the Grand Opening of their East Center in Antioch! @CCFamilyJustice (1/3)
Today is #NationalVoterRegistrationDay! Have your voice heard in our next election by registering to vote today: https://registertovote.ca.gov #BeAVoter
Here’s the info for both of today’s events—come say hello!
There’s still time for you to join us for coffee and conversation in Vallejo! I’ll be here until 11am before I head to Pleasant Hill to meet with more members of our community #CommunityCoffee

Come have a coffee with me this Saturday in Vallejo or Pleasant Hill! I'll be gathering with members of our community to talk about this year's legislative session and hope to hear from you about the issues you care most about.
Wonderful news, congratulations! Hope you are able to enjoy these precious first moments together

Cities don’t want to have to disclose developer fees that drive up the cost of housing in our state, which is why they are requesting that the Governor veto my bill #AB1483. We need to bring transparency to our housing policies if we ever hope to pull CA out of this crisis

This year I joined my colleagues in authoring a resolution to urge Congress to support and pass @RepThompson’s #HR8. We need to do more to protect ourselves and our children from gun violence. Our communities need action that will help keep them safe #EndGunViolence
Proud to be working to make California safer for everyone!
And still here working and doing the people’s business! #caleg
Proud to support legislation to shine a light on dark money in politics—thank you @AsmCervantes! #DISCLOSEAct

I’ve been working hard on a lot of legislation this year, but #AB1116 is especially meaningful to me. After our state has seen some of its deadliest wildfires, AB 1116 will ensure firefighters have access to effective mental health services. It is now headed to the Gov’s desk

Another bill headed to Governor @GavinNewsom’s desk! Air ambulances are at risk of losing the funding they need to operate in our state—my bill #AB651 will make sure Californians still have access to their lifesaving services
This victory would not have been possible without our strong coalition of supporters who tirelessly advocated for hardworking, vulnerable Californians and to #StopLoanSharks #AB539
Celebrating with @Rendon63rd as the roll closed and #AB539 passed the Floor!
Thank you @Rendon63rd for helping us #StopTheDebtTrap! @AsmMoniqueLimon #AB539
Just now @AsmMoniqueLimon and I just passed #AB539 to end triple-digit & predatory loans in our state! It is now headed to the Governor’s desk

“On behalf of emergency room doctors and the patients we serve, I implore our state leaders to take action now to save air ambulances and save lives.” Proud to author #AB651 to ensure that air ambulances do not lose the funding they need to operate in CA

Thank you to @SenHJMitchell for presenting #AB539 on the Senate Floor! My bill with @AsmMoniqueLimon to end the worst kinds of predatory lending in our state is now only one vote away from reaching the Governor’s desk #StopTheDeptTrap
Thank you Governor for your support of my bill with @DavidChiu @RobBontaCA and @BuffyWicks! All Californians are deserving of housing stability #AB1482

Isabel’s life is in danger because she has been threatened with deportation despite living here legally for 16 years. The federal administration eliminated the visa program that allowed her to live here while receiving lifesaving treatment & now they can’t answer why. #SaveIsabel
Today we finally made it clear that Californians who rent are no less deserving of having a stable roof over their head #AB1482

For millions of Californians, we got it done—thank you to everyone who helped pass #AB1482, especially our lead author @DavidChiu, Speaker @Rendon63rd, and our many fellow authors @RobBontaCA @BuffyWicks @AsmRichardBloom @AsmCarrillo @Ash_Kalra
Tenant protections should not be sacrificed simply because production isn’t up to par. It is a false choice whether it has to be landlords or tenants. #AB1482 provides for both
With @SenToniAtkins on the Assembly Floor working to pass meaningful protections for tenants #AB1482
#AB1482 is on the Assembly Floor now. Let’s get this passed for the millions of Californians who rent their homes

My bill #AB1117 is headed to the Gov’s desk with unanimous support! AB 1117 works to ensure that sworn peace officers are receiving effective mental health services to help them cope w/ trauma they endure during their careers. A meaningful day to vote to support first responders
I am so thankful for the first responders who came to our country’s rescue that day and every day since #ThankYou #NeverForget
There are many touching displays throughout our neighborhoods to help us remember those we lost 18 years ago today. May their memories be a blessing to their families and loved ones #NeverForget
Proud to be joining an effort to honor Congresswoman Ellen Tauscher. Her passing was a great loss, but her legacy will continue to inspire us all in the Bay Area and beyond

Thank you, Governor @GavinNewsom, for your support. For too many Californians an unjust eviction or sudden rent hike could be the difference between having safe place to live and being forced onto the streets. Let’s act and pass #AB1482 @DavidChiu @RobBontaCA @BuffyWicks
Now let’s get #AB1482 off the Assembly Floor and onto the Governor’s desk! @SenToniAtkins @DavidChiu @RobBontaCA @BuffyWicks @SenateHertzberg

AB 1482’s coalition of support continues to grow, encompassing not only tenants, but also property owners, builders, and some of the largest employers in the state. I’m looking forward to working with leadership and my fellow authors to move this bill past it’s final hurdle

AB 1484 works to ensure that local fees on development align with our statewide housing goals. I look forward to using the interim recess to continue conversations with my colleagues, industry and advocacy groups, labor, local jurisdictions, and constituents throughout our state

With the leadership of Governor @GavinNewsom, I am confident that my fellow co-authors and I will be able to pass this legislation and finally deliver some security for renters. #AB1482 @DavidChiu @RobBontaCA @BuffyWicks
#AB1482 is necessary to provide critical protections to the millions of Californians who rent, shielding them from the harm that comes from suddenly losing the roof over their heads.
Proud that we have reached a deal to bring needed stability to tenants throughout our state. #AB1482
And read more about her story in this article from the @nytimes
You can sign the petition to help #LetIsabelStay here

Everyone should hear about Isabel Bueso’s story. Isabel is a Concord resident who came to the US with a visa to receive lifesaving medical treatment, but is now at risk of being deported #LetIsabelStay #SaveIsabel

We must treat all threats to commit violence w/ the gravity they demand which is why I have authored #AB907 to make it a crime to threaten to commit violence against our schools & places of worship. Lets hold accountable those who are purposefully creating fear in our communities

Threats like these are traumatic for students, parents, and teachers, especially in our current climate where gun violence has devastated far too many of our hometowns. I am thankful that law enforcement was able to intervene today and possibly prevent the next tragedy.

Just today law enforcement apprehended a suspect after social media threats against a Sacramento-area school circulated online. Messages allegedly posted on Snapchat purportedly said "I'm shooting up Jesuit" and "I'm currently shooting up my school"

Thank you @CalChiefs_CFCA for publishing this important Op-Ed about how we must pass legislation I authored to fund air ambulances and ensure that they can continue to operate and save lives in our state. #AB651 #AirAmbulances

"[A]ir ambulances are an essential part of the statewide emergency response system. AB 651 would update the Medi-Cal rates that air ambulance providers receive[...] Absent this type of action, the availability of these lifesaving services is in jeopardy."

We need to help and support those who work to keep our communities safe which is why I have authored legislation to make effective mental health services more accessible for our firefighters and peace officers #AB1116 #AB1117

“Echeverria said her brother was worried that seeking help would get him assigned to desk work“. Too often our first responders suffer in silence because they fear negative repercussions at their jobs for seeking help.

When we treat violent threats w/ the gravity they demand then we give law enforcement the opportunity to prevent the next tragedy. My bill #AB907 will hold those who threaten to commit violence against our schools & places of worship accountable
Thank you @AMR_Social providing CPR lessons for kids and adults!
More information here!
I’m here at Mt Diablo High School setting up for my Public Health & Safety Fair! We’ll be here until 1pm with 20+ agencies and organizations with free resources and health screenings!
Our firefighters are doing everything that they can to keep us safe. Please do your part and make sure you are doing all you can to prevent a wildfire: http://www.preventwildfireca.org/

Californians can't wait over a decade for new housing projects to be built. Stories like the one below are why I am authoring and fighting for legislation to help our communities build the housing they need.

Thank you for bringing some joy to our community!

Come say hello to my staff and pick up some information at our table at @CA_Concord’s #NationalNightOut2019 at the Concord Library!

In just a couple of weekends I will be hosting a free Public Health & Safety Fair in Concord. I hope you and your family will be able to join me and the many great organizations who will be providing free information & services! More info here: https://www.facebook.com/events/601503080374092/
Awesome support from one of our Bay Area teams! #ChooseToInclude

UPDATE: ALL CLEAR As of 8PM the Shelter In Place has been lifted. Marsh Creek Rd from Morgan Territory Rd to Deer Valley Rd is only open to residents with a valid ID at this time. Tomorrow, 8/4, there will be a hard closure of this area starting at 7am until a mop up is complete
Emergency Shelter In Place on Marsh Creek Rd from Morgan Territory Rd to Deer Valley Rd is *still in effect* due to the fires
Great working being done by our firefighters. As of 12pm, the Shelter In Place **is still in effect**

You can read more about June's Annual California Nonprofits Day celebration & @ChoiceinAging on my website: https://a14.asmdc.org/press-releases/assemblymember-grayson-honors-choice-aging-nonprofit-year #CalNonprofits (3/3)
It was wonderful to be able to join @ChoiceinAging again two days ago on a site tour of their Pleasant Hill location & see firsthand how they are serving and helping our community! (2/3)

.@ChoiceinAging provides incredible supports and services for those in our elderly community so they can live happy, healthy and independent lives. In June, Choice in Aging joined me in Sacramento as I had the honor of recognizing them as AD 14's Nonprofit of the Year. (1/3)
In the studio about to film an interview about social media safety and my bill #AB1280 to help protect our kids online. Can’t wait to share it with you all soon!

This year alone, our country has seen over 200 mass shootings. The recent tragedy at the Gilroy Garlic Festival only underscores what has been evident for years: we must do more to end gun violence. My heart goes out to the victims and survivors of yesterday’s shooting
Proud to be the author of #AB651 to fund air ambulances!
Thrilled to be able to announce some exciting news for @SONorCal and @SOSoCal! #SpecialOlympics #ChooseToInclude

@AsmMoniqueLimon and I are beginning our testimony in front of the Senate Banking & Finance Committee to ban predatory lending in our state #AB539

This morning @SacBeeEditBoard wrote about #AB539, the bill @AsmMoniqueLimon and I authored to end predatory lending in our state, and the detriment that these abusive, triple-digit loans can have on families. You can read more below. #StopTheDebtTrap
Great work by our firefighters!
A list of cooling centers around Contra Costa today #HeatAdvisory
Thank you @SOSoCal for welcoming me to the Summer Games this weekend! It was a thrill and inspiration to meet so many athletes! #WeAreSOSC #ChooseToInclude @SONorCal @Rendon63rd @L2ChangCA

If we’re going to promote production & fight to preserve our affordable housing stock, then we have to also include conversations about protections for tenants. I’m proud to have moved a serious conversation on just cause evictions forward, & our fight does not end here. #AB1481

Tonight the Assembly voted to pass #AB1482 to protect tenants from rent-gouging. Thank you to Assemblymembers @DavidChiu @RobBontaCA and @BuffyWicks for being great partners to me as we work to provide protections for the millions of renters in our state #AB1482 #AB1481 #CALeg

#AB1481 #AB1482 “If California has any hope of easing homelessness, the state has to adopt tenant protections to ensure that people living on the edge financially don’t get pushed into homelessness by exorbitant rent hikes or unwarranted evictions."

Thank you to my co-author @AsmMoniqueLimon and all my colleagues who voted to pass #AB539 on the Assembly Floor! Proud to be working to end the worst kinds of predatory loans in our state and #StopTheDebtTrap

Today I announced amendments to #AB1481 with my joint-author Assemblymember @RobBontaCA to provide millions of California renters with critical protections. Speaker @Rendon63rd is spot on. #AB539 #StopTheDebtTrap @AsmMoniqueLimon

Predatory loans hurt California families. I am proud to have partnered with @AsmMoniqueLimon in joint-authoring #AB539 to end abusive lending, protect hard-working people, and #StopTheDebtTrap. You can read more in today's edition of @sacbee_news
Proud to be joint-authoring #AB539 with @AsmMoniqueLimon to #StopTheDebtTrap and end abusive, predatory lending in our state
Thank you to teachers throughout California and around the world for changing the lives of students every day and helping them have bright futures! #TeacherAppreciationDay
Thank YOU for taking the time to stop by my office!

Heartbroken to hear of the loss of Ellen Tauscher, and I wish her family and loved ones comfort during this painful time. Ellen's dedicated and accomplished career in public service enriched the lives of her constituents in the East Bay, California, and beyond.

Every day, at least nine Americans die and 100 are injured in distracted driving crashes. Today, on the last day of #DistractedDrivingAwarenessMonth I hope you'll join me in pledging to put down our phones and #justdrive @chp

Today I was very lucky to have my sister, Shari, with me on the Floor to celebrate #WorldDownSyndromeDay and help spread awareness on how fun, loving, and capable those with Down syndrome are. I'm thrilled my colleagues got to experience some of the joy she brings to every room!
Thank you @SenToniAtkins! Shari loved meeting you and telling you about how important the Special Olympics are to her and others in the I/DD community @SONorCal @SOSoCal
Shari also helped spread plenty of smiles and laughs along the way!

As someone who has different abilities herself, Shari was the perfect person to join me and the presidents of @SONorCal and @SOSoCal in delivering budget request letters to @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom and Speaker @Rendon63rd to help fund Special Olympics and their athletes

As a survivor of child abduction herself, Midsi has shown incredible strength by assisting families affected by abduction and using her personal story to educate others on abduction prevention through her non-profit, the Midsi Sanchez Foundation.
Today I had the honor of recognizing Midsi Sanchez as #AD14's Woman of the Year. Midsi is a lifelong @CityofVallejo resident and a tireless advocate for missing children and child safety #WOTY2019
